What is the difference between null and undefined?
options: Undefined means a variable has been declared but has not yet been assigned a value, while null is an assignment value
Undefined is an assignment value, while null means a variable has been declared but has not yet been assigned a value

questions.right_answer: Undefined means a variable has been declared but has not yet been assigned a value, while null is an assignment value

questions.question: What is the DOM?
What is a closure?

A way to declare a variable that cannot be changed

questions.question: What is event bubbling?
options: The process of capturing all events on a page
The process of capturing events on the child elements of an element
The process of capturing events on the parent elements of an element
The process of capturing events on all elements on a page
questions.right_answer: The process of capturing events on the parent elements of an element

questions.question: What is a promise?
options: A way to handle errors in JavaScript
A way to handle asynchronous operations in JavaScript
A way to handle arrays in JavaScript
A way to handle objects in JavaScript
questions.right_answer: A way to handle asynchronous operations in JavaScript

questions.question: What is a callback function?
options: A function that is called when an event occurs
A function that is passed as an argument to another function
A function that is called when an error occurs
A function that is called when a promise is resolved
questions.right_answer: A function that is passed as an argument to another function

questions.question: What is scope in JavaScript?
options: The range of values that a variable can hold
The range of functions that can access a variable
The range of values that a function can return
The range of objects that can be created in JavaScript
questions.right_answer: The range of functions that can access a variable

questions.question: What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A function that returns another function
A function that has access to its outer function scope even after the outer function has returned
A function that has no name
A function that can only be called once
questions.right_answer: A function that has access to its outer function scope even after the outer function has returned
